programme.title: The Range Busters
programme.desc: The Range Busters (Ray Corrigan, John King, Max Terhune) make their cowboy-trio debut, hunting a phantom killer.

programme.title: A Lust to Kill
programme.desc: A marshal (Jim Davis) uses an outlaw's (Don Megowan) girlfriend (Allison Hayes) as bait to lure him into a showdown.

programme.title: With Sitting Bull at the Spirit Lake Massacre
programme.desc: Chief Sitting Bull surveys the settlement at Spirit Lake from afar and vows to retake the land that once belonged to his forefathers.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Trouble at a tungsten mine in San Pablo, Mexico.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Pat and Stoney tangle with a gang of robbers who have hijacked an Army payroll.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Kate wants to hide the Hooterville Cannonball to save it from the scrap heap.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.sub-title: The President Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: The railroad president decides to scrap the Cannonball himself.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A crooked stagecoach driver accuses Cisco and Pancho of stealing $50,000 from him.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A prominent investment broker is captured after scheming to have two of his men impersonate Cisco and Pancho at a bank hold-up.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: The Younger Brothers, certain their past with the Quantrill Riders prevents them from living an honest life, plan a bold bank robbery that Matt and Frankie attempt to thwart.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt investigates the deaths of two Osage Indians.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Judge Bean discovers that a young vagabond he jailed for a minor offense might be involved in a major unsolved gold heist.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Judge Roy Bean endeavors to exact justice in the small town of Langtry in the Old West. Starring Edgar Buchanan, Jack Beutel, and Jackie Laughery. In this episode, a con involving the Haunted Hills draws Judge Roy's attention.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie (Gail Davis) challenges a mine owner's spoiled rich daughter (Maura Murphy) to a race. With Tom London.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: After being framed and serving seven years in prison, a bitter man (Harry Lauter) returns to town. With Gail Davis.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Army payroll messengers are found dead, murdered by a gang of bandits, and the payroll stolen; in order to find the killers, Hawkeye and Chingachcook go undercover as managers of a local trading post.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Fur trader McKenzie initiates a war between the Hurons and the nearby settlement where another trader is taking his business.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Adam is taken hostage by a band of U.S. Army prisoners who have escaped and sought refuge on the Ponderosa.

programme.title: In Old Cheyenne
programme.desc: A singing reporter (Roy Rogers) and a framed man (George "Gabby" Hayes) put a town boss out of business.

programme.title: Man From Music Mountain
programme.desc: A radio-singing cowboy (Roy Rogers) turns sheriff to save a sheepwoman (Ruth Terry) from a cattleman (Paul Kelly).

programme.title: Public Cowboy, No. 1
programme.desc: Modern-day cattle rustlers use a radio, airplanes and refrigerator trucks to expedite their illegal schemes.

programme.title: Yellowneck
programme.desc: A sergeant (Lin McCarthy), a colonel (Stephen Courtleigh), a thief (Berry Kroeger) and two other Rebel deserters trek toward Cuba through the Everglades.

programme.title: Daniel Boone
programme.desc: The frontiersman (George O'Brien) leads settlers to Kentucky, where a white renegade (John Carradine) unites tribes against them.

programme.title: Riders of Destiny
programme.desc: Agent Saunders (John Wayne) becomes partners with Fay (Cecelia Parker) to help her fight off a gang run by a local land grabber.

programme.title: In Old Colorado
programme.desc: Hopalong Cassidy (William Boyd) stops Joe Weiler (Morris Ankrum) from instigating a prairie war between two ranchers.

programme.title: The Legend of the Lone Ranger
programme.desc: A masked rider and an American Indian named Tonto team up to fight crime on horseback.

programme.title: The Light of Western Stars
programme.desc: A Boston socialite (Jo Ann Sayers) attracts a ruffian (Victor Jory) along the Mexican border circa 1915.

programme.title: Broadway to Cheyenne
programme.desc: A New York police officer, shot and wounded by a gangster, travels to Cheyenne, Wyo., to recuperate at his family's ranch, and is surprised to find a bootlegger from New York running a speakeasy there.

programme.title: Born to Battle
programme.desc: Cattlemen offer a jailed cowboy his freedom if he will agree to help locate a gang of notorious rustlers.
